articles.content:
S. Korean Student Councils Decide to Wage Joint Struggle 
    Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Thirtyone general student councils of south Korea including those of Korea University and Sungkyunkwan University called a press conference on January 16 and announced their decision to wage a joint struggle to check the increase of registration fees, according to south Korean KBS.
 They declared that they would form a joint measure committee for a stop to the increase of registration fees and revision of the law on private schools and strive together to win the rights of students and, to this end, launch a campaign for the delay of the payment of registration fees, a relay-style one-man protest and so on.

articles.content:
Japan's Compensation to Victims Demanded 
    Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The Association of Bereaved Families of the Pacific War Dead and other civic and public organizations on January 17
decided to enter into an action for compensation vis-a-vis the governments of Japan and south Korea, timing to coincide with the publication of some diplomatic documents of the south Korea-Japan talks, according to south Korean MBC.
 Noting that the Japan government had failed to send back even the remains of victims to the brutality of the Japanese imperialists, they stated they would receive reports from bereaved families and claim reparation for mental damage. They also decided to bring a suit against the government of south Korea to claim compensation to those who were taken away in labor draft during the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists.    
 They said they would also prepare a lawsuit concerning renegotiation on the "south Korea-Japan agreement".

Repeal of "Draft Amendment to Law on Broadcasting" Demanded
    Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Media Workers Unions of south Korea made public a statement on Jan. 14 in which it demanded the authorities repeal the "draft amendment to the law on broadcasting" at once, south Korean KBS reported.
 The statement denounced the recent decision made by the Broadcasting Committee to amend the law on broadcasting as an intrigue to bring KBS under control of the "government" and the political camp, utterly indifferent to its special characteristics.

Delegation of Kim Il Sung University Leaves for Russia
    Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Kim Il Sung University headed by its President Song Ja Rip left here today to participate in the commemorations of the 250th anniversary of the foundation of Moscow M.V. Lomonosov State University in Russia.
 It was seen off at the airport by O Kil Bang, vice-president of Kim Il Sung University, and Andrei Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.
